_comment: CATEGORY TEMPLATE - Use this when creating a NEW category file
_usage: 2. Replace CATEGORY_NAME with actual category name (lowercase, camelCase)
4. Update KnowledgeService.cs switch statement (lines 75-88) to map category name to file path
5. Fill in operations array with actual operations (use _operation_template.json as guide)
note: Optional context about this category - when to use it, what operations belong here, any special considerations

operations._example_operation: This is an example - replace with real operations
operations.summary: One-sentence description of what this operation does

requiredSteps: ✓ Category added to categories.json with correct count
✓ All operations have method, summary, category fields

_whenToCreateNewCategory: Existing category would exceed 12-15 operations after addition
Operations form distinct logical group that doesn't fit existing categories
Entity type has no existing category (e.g., if adding SalesOrder operations)
Functional area is clearly separate (e.g., reporting, analytics, webhooks)
_preferExistingCategory: ALWAYS prefer adding to existing category over creating new one unless clear justification exists
